task.title: Install Matplotlib
task.shortdesc: Install the matplotlib library in Python, which is necessary for creating data visualizations.

step.info: Before installing matplotlib, ensure that Python and pip are installed on your system. Run python3 --version to check Python and pip --version to check if pip is installed.

stepxmp.codeblock:
# Check Python version python3 --version
# Check pip version pip --version

step.cmd: If either Python or pip is missing
step.info: If either Python or pip is missing, follow these steps to install them: Run python3 -m ensurepip to install pip and download Python from the official website if necessary.

stepxmp.codeblock: # Install pip if missing python3 -m ensurepip

step.info: Once Python and pip are installed, install Matplotlib with the following command: pip install matplotlib.
After installation, verify that Matplotlib is installed correctly by running the following Python code in your Python IDE: import matplotlib.pyplot as plt followed by print(matplotlib.__version__).

stepxmp.codeblock: # Verify Matplotlib installation import matplotlib.pyplot as plt print(matplotlib.__version__)
